poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: I'll fix you captions to imagined flicks, Supply the flints and tinder for a lantern To launch a shimmering skiff in your picture house, Fits and starts of sense that flits A little beyond your reach. It flirts with you. Be a bit less stiff, Stop making pocketfuls of fists In that raincoat no one frisks (The filth has other stuff in mind: In fifths and syncopation the chase-scene flips, He gets away. The feds get just the spilth.)
